channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for NJ
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for NJ

item.title: Report E-2023110055
item.description:
Report E-2023110055

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-07T18:15:22+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-19
  • City: BURLINGTON
  • State: NJ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On October 19, 2023, one (1) 55-gallon drum of UN1760 was punctured by a forklift and released approximately one (1) gallon of product to the dock surface. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from First Call Environmental (FCE) to remediate the impacted site. Crews collected the damaged drum and placed in in one (1) 85-gallon over pack. FCE personnel utilized hand tools to collect all granular absorbents applied by RLC. All ammonium hydroxide impacted material was collected and containerized in one (1) 55-gallon drum and both drums were added to RLC waste stream for disposal.

item.title: Report X-2023090043
item.description:
Report X-2023090043

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-04T06:23:51+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-01
  • City: NEWARK
  • State: NJ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: A fiberboard box was discovered with signs of release at the EWRH facility. The fiberboard box contacted four metal containers with fiberboard dividers. Two of the metal containers were damaged on the bottom cause a release inside of the box. All contents were placed into a steel salvage package and the shipper was contacted for an amended declaration for movement.

item.title: Report X-2023100228
item.description:
Report X-2023100228

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-01T18:13:50+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-23
  • City: KEASBEY
  • State: NJ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: DURING THE OVERNIGHT SORT THE PACKAGE WAS BROUGHT TO THE HAZMAT CAGE SHOWING OBVIOUS SIGNS OF THE BOX BEING DROPPED AND 2 BOTTLES OF ISOPROPYL IS MISSING. UPON FURTHER INSPECTION THE REMAING 2 BOTTLES WERE HURRIEDLY PLACED IN A SALVAGE DRUM TO BE RETURNED TO THE SHIPPER UNLESS OTHERWISE DescribePack: FAILURE OF THE PACKAGE WAS DUE TO THE PACKAGED BEING DROPPED AND 2 OF THE ISOPROPYL GOING MISSING. DurationRel: 4 and MitigateEffect: THE REMAINING CONTENTS WERE PLACED IN A LINED SALAVAGE DRUM TO AWAIT DISPOSITION.

item.title: Report X-2023100213
item.description:
Report X-2023100213

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-01T18:13:50+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-23
  • City: KEASBEY
  • State: NJ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package arrived at hazmat during Sunrise sort in plastic drum. DescribePack: Inspection of "FISHER SCIENTIFIC HYDROCHLORIC ACID" showed box to be wet and smoking, most likely broken from being dropped or mishandled. DurationRel: 12 and MitigateEffect: Remaining contents will be disposed of in a salvage drum.
